availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Thomas C. Fitzhugh (Woodford County, Kentucky, physician and soldier - Asst. Surgeon 21st Ky. Inf.)

body.p: Woodford County, Kentucky, physician and soldier. Virginia native. Studied medicine in Stafford County, Virginia, in 1850. Physician in Woodford County, Kentucky, in 1860. Served in the Kentucky State Militia as a surgeon in Woodford County in 1861. Served in the 21st Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as an assistant surgeon from April 2, 1862 to June 8, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Virginia, Stafford County, Eastern District, p. 25B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Woodford County, Versailles, p. 831.
“Fitzhugh, Thomas C.,” Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers Who Served in Organizations From the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 03337.
KYR-0001-025-0071.
